questions.question_text: Gary is checking for the devices connected to USB ports of a suspect system during an investigation. Select the appropriate tool that will help him document all the connected devices.

discussion.content: DevCon (Devcon.exe), the Device Console, is a command-line tool that displays detailed information about devices on computers running Windows. You can use DevCon to enable, disable, install, configure, and remove devices.
Hint: "They broke our AUP!" *During investigation, find CP* Yep criminal case now

questions.question_text: If you discover a criminal act while investigating a corporate policy abuse, it becomes a publicsector investigation and should be referred to law enforcement?

discussion.content:
Just a crime, man. No matters where to happens or if the computer belongs or not to the company. A crime is a crime, so is a criminal investigation, performed by public sector forensics.

Different case is, if the company suspects this guy is commiting a crime. Investigation begins as administrative, but soon will become a public sector one, and all the evidences will be sent to the officers.
This should be C. Its a work computer so an Administrative investigation is also required.

questions.question_text:
Gary, a computer technician, is facing allegations of abusing children online by befriending them and sending them illicit adult images from his office computer.
What type of investigation does this case require?

choices.B: [Wed Oct 11 14:32:52 2000] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] client denied by server configuration: /export/home/live/ap/htdocs/test

questions.question_text: The Apache server saves diagnostic information and error messages that it encounters while processing requests. The default path of this file is usr/local/apache/ logs/error.log in Linux. Identify the Apache error log from the following logs.
What binary coding is used most often for e-mail purposes?

discussion.content: B. Uuencode is used to transport binary images via email
IMAP and SMTP are mail transfer protocols
